alert.note: Alert for McMinn; Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 11:36PM CDT until August 15 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN MCMINN AND SOUTHWESTERN MONROE COUNTIES... At 1236 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen over the past three hours and an additional 1 to 2 inches will be possible over the next hour. Additionally, law enforcement has reported as much as three feet of water over roadways in parts of Tellico Plains, and that there are first responders tending to people stranded in cars and homes. Life threatening flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Madisonville, Tellico Plains, Niota, Mount Vernon and Bullet Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
